item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 10, 2024 at 8:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. OpenCoder: Open Cookbook for Top-Tier Code Large Language Models (393 points | 44 comments)
2. Shaderblocks: Block-based image editing (56 points | 5 comments)
3. IronCalc – Open-Source Spreadsheet Engine (380 points | 109 comments)
4. Physical Intelligence's first generalist policy AI can finally do your laundry (49 points | 5 comments)
5. Show HN: Visprex – Open-source, in-browser data visualisation tool for CSV files (114 points | 12 comments)
6. NYC Subway Station Layouts (179 points | 55 comments)
7. Show HN: Jaws – a JavaScript to WASM ahead-of-time compiler (187 points | 71 comments)
8. Zig's (.{}){} Syntax (168 points | 77 comments)
9. FrontierMath: A benchmark for evaluating advanced mathematical reasoning in AI (104 points | 46 comments)
10. A skeleton made from the bones of at least eight people thousands of years apart (48 points | 10 comments)
11. Mergiraf: a syntax-aware merge driver for Git (346 points | 75 comments)
12. GenMC: Model checking for concurrent C programs (7 points | discuss)
13. Early Cascade Injection: From Windows process creation to stealthy injection (98 points | 11 comments)
14. Grim Fandango (190 points | 62 comments)
15. Hard Cases for a Handle Theory (16 points | 1 comment)
16. Measuring keyboard-to-photon latency with a light sensor (2023) (5 points | 2 comments)
17. Show HN: HTML-to-Markdown – convert entire websites to Markdown with Golang/CLI (278 points | 43 comments)
18. When machine learning tells the wrong story (120 points | 10 comments)
19. HPV vaccination: How the world can eliminate cervical cancer (360 points | 164 comments)
20. Ticketmaster’s attempt to game arbitration services fails (276 points | 114 comments)
21. You too can write a book (121 points | 40 comments)
22. Texture-Less Text Rendering (188 points | 46 comments)
23. Scientist treated her own cancer with viruses she grew in the lab (484 points | 175 comments)
24. Earth Could Be Alien to Humans by 2500 (2021) (7 points | 2 comments)
25. Obtainium: Get Android App Updates Directly from the Source (186 points | 78 comments)
26. Somebody moved the UK's oldest satellite in the mid 1970s, but no one knows who (115 points | 61 comments)
27. Since the '60s, Ford has stored cars underground in a Kansas City cave (165 points | 66 comments)
28. Notes on Guyana (135 points | 107 comments)
29. Can humans say the largest prime number before we find the next one? (296 points | 132 comments)
30. SVDQuant: 4-Bit Quantization Powers 12B Flux on a 16GB 4090 GPU with 3x Speedup (161 points | 56 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 10, 2024 at 8:15 AM UTC
